ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I really enjoyed this short course on Ethics. It was helpful to have the visiting professor from the Divinity School to talk about the philosophical basis of ethics. I liked working on the case studies and found that portion of the course the most helpful. I would suggest that there be case studies expanded beyond traditional consulting examples.
The instructor was great at respecting every student's answer and challenging comments.
This workshop provides useful advice on maintaining positive professional neutrality. Recommended for all aspiring professionals.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Helps MF students step back and think about big picture ethical issues they may face in the workplace.
Discussing the case studies with fellow students
case studiesa nice mix of applied and high level
This course was great at challenging what we all believe, and great at putting a context to a subject that can only be understood situationally!
The guest speaker from the divinity school and the case studies.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: More structure.
More variety in the case studies

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The course material and the discussion worked perfectly together! Everything that we read and were told was applicable to the case studies we practiced.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Useful and not a huge time commitment, so I liked it.
This is important for our MF program, and I definitely think that we should keep this short course as part of the curriculum.
This course is ESSENTIAL to the Masters of Forestry program! I'm very glad it is required!
This workshop is useful for anyone that will work with others.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Required for MFs.
Required for the MF program
requirement
Requirement
Required; interested.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes
yes
Yes
Yes the knowledge& skills gained met my expectations
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Bouncing ideas around and weighing the pros and cons of various actions in an ethical context
This way we were able to discuss the topics and bring in new ideas about what is appropriate in the workplace.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: While required for MFs, still worth the half-day of learning.
Definitely attend!
Bring a pencil and paper.
